item.title: Ticket #515 (Title and Description Should be "Texturized") created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description: Some output from the bloginfo template tag (such as <?php bloginfo('description') ?> and <?php bloginfo('name') ?>) should be processed with Texturize to replace quotes, apostrophes and other punctuations with their "smart" equivalents.

item.title: Ticket #513 (prev next page on category dont works) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
wp 1.3 2004 12 03 permalink structure: /%category%/%postname%/

/%category%/page/2/ gives me a "Sorry, no entry matched your criteria."

item.title: Changeset [1908]: Move rewrite and permalink functions into WP_Rewrite class.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Move rewrite and permalink functions into WP_Rewrite class.

item.title: Ticket #512 (Relative URLs different in preview vs. published.) created
item.dc:creator: deane
item.description:
It appears that when writing a new blog entry the current working directory is one level deeper (e.g. 'wordpress/wp-admin') than it is when viewing the final entry (e.g. just 'wordpress').

This means that relative URLs which work in the preview window (e.g. ../images/myImage.png) don't work when the entry is published, and relative URLs which work in a published entry (e.g. images/myImage.png) don't work in the preview window.

Obviously I can get around the problem by using absolute URLs rather than relative, but that means that if I want to move my journal to a different site then I have to edit all of the URLs.

It would be nice if both journal creation and viewing took place from the same current directory so that relative URLs would work in both.

item.title: Ticket #511 (No separator for link_pages function.) created
item.dc:creator: mczolton
item.description: The current CVS version of 'template-function-post.php' does not allow the user to define a separator between the 'previous page' and 'next page' links. If you feel this functionality is necessary, I have provided a code snippet that will solve this issue.
